text: I see a good looking Metroidvania, I buy. Think of a mix between a Metroidvania and Dark Souls with Spanish vibes... and then apply a coat of Catholic paintings mixed with horror. The dark and disturbing atmosphere is enough for it to be a game I won't forget. The combat system is satisfying, though the barebones skill tree felt like a missed opportunity. I thought the difficulty was great and while I heard it's too hard for some, I thought it was much easier than any Souls game. By far the most negative aspect was the map traversal because of the horrible lack of teleportation points, I really don't understand what they were thinking by adding so few of them. Oh and if you discover an item you cannot reach yet or a merchant, good luck trying to remember where they were because of the map not marking anything. It's too bad really, because apart from that I can hardly find any big faults. It's a great game.
author: SupraDarky

text:
I remember watching an early trailer for Blasphemous which was a bit underwhelming and hoping it wasn't just relying on shock factor of gore and religious tone.  Happy to say it is a pretty well fleshed out Metroidvania with a huge map, constantly intriguing atmosphere/story,  tons of hidden items/upgrades/relics/"powers" etc, quest lines. 
Aside from the obvious map and teleport problems you mentioned.  One thing I found a bit annoying was having many required "traversal" items (trying to avoid spoilers) hinge on a limited relic equip system...I really don't see the advantage from not having most of them "always on".

author: SupraDarky

text:
@SupraDarky I had Diablo feelings playing this too. The first time I reached Albero I stopped to listen the song and surrendered to memories and nostalgia. I like to let my mind fly wild listening to some songs.

Also, your channel was the first I subscribed too. Can't remember exactly when, but I think it was around 2008. Didn't had a habit of subscribing back then, and spent some years away from YouTube
I was happy to see your channel continuing after so many years. I'm following more closely now since 2016.

Cheers and thanks for many good moments through the years!
